title: Scottish independence campaign battles over NHS and Nato amid worries over referendum divisions- As it happened` | Politics | The Guardian
summary: ewing : snp would not split after independence .

text: and here 's a tory intervention .

three former conservative scottish secretaries have released a statement outlining their case for a no vote in the independence referendum , describing the economic and financial case for ending the union as unarguable '' .

lord ( ian ) lang of monckton , sir malcolm rifkind and lord ( michael ) forsyth of drumlean said they believe that the value and the emotional appeal of the present union is far more compelling than the mirage of independence '' .

their statement says : from our knowledge gained in government , we maintain that the economic and financial case against breaking up the united kingdom is so clear as to be unarguable ; that any hope that with independence scotland could achieve material or social objectives unavailable within the union is vain ; and that the chance of scotland maintaining in isolation the wealth and strength she enjoys as part of britain is non-existent .

the snp have hit back with a statement saying that no campaign was facing ridicule after drafting in the tory scottish secretaries who delivered the poll tax to try and stem the tide of voters moving to yes '' .

msp john swinney said : things have gone from bad to worse for the no campaign in recent days as more and more people switch their vote to yes - but they are deluding themselves if they think that calling in former tory scottish secretaries is going to do anything other than undermine their standing further .
these are the men who helped deliver the hated tory poll tax to scotland - something people in scotland have neither forgiven nor forgotten .
i 'm going to wrap things up here at this point for today .
thanks for reading .
from labour 's ranks today , johann lamont has been warning on pensions during a visit to 100 pensioners at the alive and kicking project in glasgow .

the scottish labour leader said : when financial experts ask serious questions about cross-border pensions , nicola sturgeon blindly asserts it will all be fine and insists we can have higher pensions because scots do n't live as long .
you could n't make it up .
these issues matter but the nationalists are not taking them seriously and are prepared to take this massive risk with people lives just to get what they want .
like cameron in the house of commons earlier , the liberal democrats have been on the attack at the debt default threat issue .

alistair carmichael , the liberal democrat secretary of state for scotland , said after a round table with small businesses in aberdeen : people in business know the importance of the bottom line , and the bottom line is that if we walk away from our share of the debt , scotland 's international reputation would dive , interest rates would soar and the cost of borrowing for business and consumers would shoot upwards .

the snp 's john swinney has said that independence is scotland 's one opportunity '' to banish trident : in a statement put out by the party ahead of a church of scotland hosted discussion tonight in glasgow this evening , he said : our proposals have been welcomed across the world - including from former mayor of hiroshima tadatoshi akiba who said trident removal will send a 'monumental ' message and peace campaigner bruce kent has also backed yes .

documents.title: scottish blogs review
text: here 's a first attempt at a short review of some relevant blogs in the campaign .
it 's something i 've been meaning to do ( and have been asked to as well by people in the comments section ) and intend to get back to again .
let me know ( i 'm on twitter at @ twitterid75 ) if there are others that i 'm missing out on and should take a look at next time .

yes bella calledonia , which has a range of contributors , has posts including one from the editor , mike small , called ' the audience is taking to the stage ' in which he takes stock of where the campaign is currently at and cites some upcoming cultural events supporting the yes side .
he adds : so it 's a mixture of hard politics and a sea of cultural celebration .
but also , one by one , the key myths of the campaign have been stood up to and argued down .
the economic arguments have been won or been deemed insignificant , but other key myths have now melted away .
the wings over scotland blog have a link to the latest dateline scotland video ( see post below ) and touches on developments such as yesterday 's yougov poll .
stuart campbell writes , under the heading 'assessing the earthquake ' : of course , the poll might be a rogue .
it might just be a temporary bounce from the second salmond-darling debate .
and it still shows no in front .
the yes campaign will have to redouble its efforts in the last couple of weeks , not start congratulating itself .
there are others of course ( betternation , bright green scotland and lallands peat worrier ) which i 'll get to reviewing in time hopefully .

no it looks like yes supporters are much more active in the blogosphere , but some have been mentioned to me ( not always just blogging scottish politics of course ) marketing is simple stupid ( thoughts from a marketing anti-guru ) has a new post called 'what is driving me away from the 'yes ' campaign in scotland ' if i 'm honest , i 'm being driven away by a campaign that is petulant and adolescent in its behaviour .
the tone , the tactics and the majority of the communication i see is just , well , distasteful .
part of it is the prevalence of social media .
if i look across the people who are passionate yes '' supporters that i am connected to on twitter & facebook , what i see is depressing .
elsewhere , others such as the labour hame blog has n't published a new post since august 20 .

documents.title: cameron : salmond default threat 'chilling '
text: david cameron has been talking about the referendum again - this time during prime ministers 's questions today in the house of commons .

he described first minister alex salmond 's threat to default on scotland 's share of the national debt if it votes to leave the uk one of the most chilling '' claims made throughout the referendum debate .
the scottish first minister has previously warned he will default unless scotland was able to keep using the pound as part of a sterling zone .
cameron said today : we all know what happens if you do n't pay your debt , no-one will lend you any money unless you pay a punitive interest rate .
we all know what that means for home owners - much , much higher mortgage rates .
for businesses , crippling interest rates , those are the consequences of what the separatists are proposing and we need to get that message out loud and clear in the coming days .
he was replying to a question from labour 's lindsay roy ( glenrothes ) who called the snp 's approach reckless '' .
prime minister david cameron speaks during prime minister 's questions in the house of commons .

reuters have just filed an intriguing feature looking at the implications of potential scottish independence for the queen , who is set to overtake victoria in september next year as britain 's longest reigning monarch .

the report up on the date set by the snp for scottish independence - march 24 , 2016 - which it says is laden with historical significance '' : it would be exactly 413 years after the crowns of the two countries were united following the death of elizabeth i in 1603 .
with no children of her own , elizabeth i 's cousin james vi of scotland became king of england too , although the countries remained separate sovereign states .
in 1707 , under the act of union , the crowns and parliaments of both countries were formally joined under king james 's granddaughter queen anne to form the kingdom of great britain .

reuters , which adds that british monarch is likely to still be queen of scotland since most scots are keen to retain her as head of state even if they vote to go it alone '' , says that she has remained politically neutral but gave an indication of her views on a split of her realm during a speech to mark 25 years on the throne in 1977 .
on that occasion she referred to referendums on devolved governments in scotland and wales , which were later rejected by voters .
i number kings and queens of england and of scotland , and princes of wales among my ancestors and so i can readily understand these aspirations .
but i can not forget that i was crowned queen of the united kingdom of great britain and northern ireland .
dickie arbiter , the queen 's former press secretary , said elizabeth had faced the same issue when australians voted in 1999 against becoming a republic .
he said she took the view then it was for australians to decide , and it would be the same for the scots now .
prince philip , the queen and prince charles cheer as competitors participate in a sack race at the braemar gathering in braemar in september 2012 .
cheyne/reuters

documents.title: ewing : snp would not split after independence
text: some other bits from aberdeen today - fergus ewing insisted that the snp will not disintegrate '' if there is a yes vote in the independence referendum .
the scottish government minister gave a guarantee that the party would continue and steer '' a newly-independent scotland .

ewing was pressed about what would happen to the snp in the event of a yes vote , with a member of the audience at the business breakfast asking : the snp is an umbrella party with a range of political views from the left and the right .
assuming a yes vote , is it not inevitable that the snp will disintegrate and the new scotland will be propelled into political chaos and consequential stagnation for the country ?
ewing replied : i think i can answer that no .

the reason i can say that with absolute conviction is very simple : people like myself , alex salmond , ( education secretary ) mike russell , ( finance secretary ) john swinney , ( justice secretary ) kenny macaskill , ( deputy first minister ) nicola sturgeon , we 've all known each other for two to three to four decades .

alastair darling , who was at the same event , meanwhile said he was absolutely confident '' that scots will vote to stay in the uk but conceded the referendum campaign will be a race to the wire '' .
i 'm going to take a break now for a wee bit .

one for later - scotland 's finance secretary , john swinney , and the leader of the liberal democrats in the house of lords , james wallace , will outline the case for and against independence in a debate chaired by the moderator of the church of scotland , john chalmers .
it starts at 7pm at st george 's tron in glasgow .
there will be a live web stream on the church of scotland website .
here 's the link
the north sea oil sector could benefit from new tax breaks if the snp comes to power in an independent scotland , scotland 's energy minister has suggested .

fergus ewing , who was speaking at the the same oil and gas uk-organised business breakfast in aberdeen as alastair darling was - hinted at the prospect at the same time as he accused successive westminster governments of having squandered '' cash from oil revenues over the years by failing to establish an oil fund .
the snp politician said it was crystal clear '' that if changes to the tax regime were not made , the hunt for oil would move to other parts of the world where extracting it would be cheaper .
he also hit back at darling 's claims that the sector had been successful because it had benefited from a very stable tax and regulatory regime '' under uk governments .
ewing said : what the industry needs is a stable and predictable fiscal regime , and quite clearly that is what the industry has n't had over past decades .

independence would n't put an end to austerity but would actually make it worse , alastair darling said today on a visit to aberdeen , where he repeated an argument which the no side was eager to get across during last night 's stv debate between key figures on both sides .

the better together campaign leader , who was at the oil and gas uk conference , claimed that independence would mean £ 6 billion worth of cuts to public services : independence would n't put an end to austerity - it would make it worse .
and it 's the poorest who would suffer most from the extra austerity independence would bring .
higher energy and shopping bills , more expensive rents and mortgages - that is what the experts say is the reality of independence .
families in scotland do n't need more pressures to their household budget like this .
it does n't have to be this way .
we do n't need to put the life chances of young scots at risk like this .
better together leader alistair darling and managing director alexander burnett during a visit to hobesco biomass energy centre near banchory .
lawson/pa
alex salmond is in midlothian at the moment .
here he is with supporters ( some words coming up later perhaps ) the snp ( @ thesnp ) hundreds out to meet @ twitterid at penicuik precinct .

can scotland be independent and keep sterling ?
the guardian 's katie allen has been examining some of the currency options for an independent scotland - including keeping sterling , joining the euro or adopting its own new currency .

she writes that while politicians on both sides seek to make bold assertions now before the vote is in , economists reckon the reality of a yes vote would prompt compromises and above all a will to calm markets and the public with some pretty swift decisions .

rob wood , chief uk economist at the private bank berenberg and a former bank of england economist , sums this up : we expect that london and edinburgh would reach a deal on the outlines of a velvet divorce quickly in the event of a yes vote .
a long , noisy negotiation would drag out uncertainty and the short-term pain , which would suit no one .
so here 's a result you 've been waiting for - better together have won today 's penalty shoot-out against yes scotland in edinburgh .
the winning goal was scored by ben carroll , who is currently working at better together hq .

independence poses the greatest threat to the nhs in scotland , according to liberal democrat party president , tim farron , who is campaigning in the scottish borders today with scottish liberal democrat leader willie rennie .
farron said : the nhs was recently judged the best in the world by the commonwealth fund .
it is one of britain 's finest achievements and i resent the nationalists ' desperate attempt to use it to break up britain .
the reality is that only alex salmond can open the door to privatisation of scotland 's devolved nhs .
i do n't have a vote in this referendum , that is a decision for people in scotland alone to take .
but i can not sit quietly by whilst alex salmond sullies the nhs for the sake of his independence campaign .
tim farron says that independence poses the greatest threat to the nhs in scotland .
thomond .

documents.title: 'the morning after ' - de luca poem
text: just as things are becoming more heated , edinburgh poet laureate christine de luca has produced a poem , 'the morning after ' , that imagines what scots might say to each other in the immediate aftermath of the vote .

de luca , who says that her personal views are not very far off the middle of this debate and that she can see merit in both sides , wrote the poem because she wanted to urge scots to work together and find common ground .

so here 's the poem in full : let none wake despondent : one way or another we have talked plainly , tested ourselves , weighed up the sum of our knowing , ta'en tent o scholars , checked the balance sheet of risk and fearlessness , of wisdom and of folly .
was it about the powers we gain or how we use them ?
we aim for more equality ; and for tomorrow to be more peaceful than today ; for fairness , opportunity , the common weal ; a hand stretched out in ready hospitality .
it 's those unseen things that bind us , not flag or battle-weary turf or tartan .
there are dragons to slay whatever happens : poverty , false pride , snobbery , sectarian schisms still hovering .
but there 's nothing broken that 's not repairable .

we 're a citizenry of bonnie fighters , a gathered folk ; a culture that imparts , inspires , demands a rare devotion , no back-tracking ; that each should work and play our several parts to bring about the best in scotland , an open heart .
scots voting no to independence would be an astonishing act of self-harm , writes george monbiot in today 's guardian .
you can read the piece in full here , but here 's a snatch : remaining in the uk carries as much risk and uncertainty as leaving .
england 's housing bubble could blow at any time .
we might leave the european union .
some of the most determined no campaigners would take us out : witness ukip 's intention to stage a pro-union rally '' in glasgow on 12 september .
the union in question , of course , is the uk , not europe .

this reminds us of a crashing contradiction in the politics of such groups : if our membership of the eu represents an appalling and intolerable loss of sovereignty , why is the far greater loss scotland is being asked to accept deemed tolerable and necessary .
that charity penalty shoot-out for the scotland united against motor neuron disease '' campaign ( organised by mnd scotland ) has been getting underway in edinburgh .
kezia dugdale has been tweeting some kezia dugdale ( @ kdugdalemsp ) scotland united against mnd # fundacure
the former nato secretary-general , george robertson , has been pushing back at those comments by dame mariot leslie .

robertson , a former labour defence secretary under tony blair , said : ms leslie is entitled to her opinion but even she will see how difficult it would be to get 28 countries to agree to admitting a country determined to disarm another nato state .
the snp is not just non-nuclear , it is anti-nuclear and no other nato country takes that position .
expelling the uk deterrent - especially when president putin is reminding the world about his - would be seen as a serious block to scottish membership .

leslie has challenged the warnings of former nato deputy supreme allied commander in europe sir richard shirreff , who described the snp 's defence policy as dangerous '' and amateurish '' at the weekend and said scotland 's future in nato is uncertain '' if it leaves the uk and expels nuclear weapons from the clyde .
leslie , who was born in edinburgh and retired as the uk 's permanent representative to nato earlier this year , said she draws a different conclusion '' from him .
the yes campaign has welcomed the announcement by dame mariot leslie , the uk 's ambassador to nato from 2010 until her retirement earlier this year , that she intends to vote yes .
leslie was formerly director-general for defence and intelligence at the foreign and commonwealth office .

in a letter in today 's scotsman , she claims that the other 28 nato allies would be reluctant not to grant scottish membership , particularly at the current time of heightened tensions '' with russia .
she wrote : no ally would wish to interrupt the integrated nato defence arrangements in the north sea and north atlantic - least of all at a time of heightened tension with russia .

deputy first minister nicola sturgeon said : this is a very impressive and important endorsement for yes - dame mariot is an enormously experienced diplomat who worked at the highest levels , and she speaks with authority on scotland 's potential and opportunities as an independent country .
the london-based adam smith institute has put out a statement suggesting that an independent scottish economy should emulate something which the free-market think tank calls the panama model '' .
it references the world economics forum 's global rankings of economic development , released today , which names panama as having the twelfth soundest banks in the world .
the central american state also scores well in a host of other financial stability metrics , which the institute says is particularly impressive given that panama is a middle-income country .

sam bowman , research director of the adam smith institute , said : this is good news for alex salmond : panama uses the us dollar without a currency union , and the 'panama option ' may be his best bet for an independent scotland .

today 's results suggest that emulating panama by 'sterlingising ' without a currency union could give an independent scotland a remarkably robust financial system , because scotland 's banks could not depend on an unlimited central bank lender of last resort .
one little thing though did n't scotland try some sort of panama model '' once before . ?
the darien scheme was an unsuccessful scottish bid to become a world trading nation by setting up a colony on the isthmus of panama in the late 1690s .
100 most doomed expeditions in history .
the odds of a yes vote on september 18 have halved within a week according to ladbrokes .

a combination of the latest poll results and a surge of cash has triggered the 'yes ' odds to fall to 5/2 from 5/1 , with pro-independence stakes in scottish betting shops surging to up to £ 5,000 a day , the bookmaker says whilst the 'no ' outcome remains odds-on , it drifts from 1/8 to just 2/7 .
odds of just 12/1 ( from 33/1 ) are also offered about the margin of victory being under 1 % .
alex donohue of ladbrokes said : the 'yes ' price is shortening by the hour .
despite the dramatic fall in odds we 're being inundated with pro-independence wagers like never before .

documents.title: cleric intervenes on referendum 'ugliness '
text: the church of scotland 's most senior cleric has expressed fears that something ugly '' is permeating the referendum campaign , as a new poll finds that voters believe that the country will be divided after september 18 regardless of the outcome of the referendum .

libby brooks has filed a piece ( online now ) on those comments of the right rev john chalmers , moderator of the general assembly , who said : i am repelled by the name-calling and rancour we have seen in recent weeks .
we need to behave as though we are paving the way for working together whatever the outcome .
i have faith that despite divergent views most scots are behaving courteously during the run-up to the referendum .
however it has become clear that some are not .
i fear that something ugly may be beginning to permeate the independence debate .

polling for the times this morning found that 50 per cent believed that there would be remaining bitterness and division after a yes vote , while 55 % expected similar consequences if the country votes no to independence .

press review ( continued ) the times on its front page 'basement ' , the times reports that the treasury 's most senior official has admitted that it is readying a team to respond to market turmoil in the event of a vote for scottish independence .

the financial times the prospect of a close vote on scottish independence sent jitters through the city yesterday as markets reacted for the first time to what a senior banker called the 'unfathomable levels of uncertainty ' associated with a yes vote , the ft reports in its lead story .

the herald splashing on 'salmond : independence is closer than it has ever been ' , the herald leads on an upbeat '' alex salmond reacting to the latest poll showing a narrowing of the margin between the two referendum camps .
the scottish daily mail 'pound hit by yes vote fear ' is the mail 's splash , which reports that the pound sank yesterday as panic '' over scottish independence swept through the markets .
scottish republicans have urged leftwing activists to ignore an anti-independence march by the protestant orange order , which takes place five days before the referendum .

henry mcdonald and severin carrell report today : the james connolly society ( jcs ) , a pro-irish republican group which supports scottish independence , has warned its supporters not to stage any protests against the orange order parade through central edinburgh to avoid violent clashes damaging the yes campaign .

the parade on saturday 13 september is expected to draw up to 15,000 members of scottish and northern irish orange order lodges and flute bands , as well as the loyalist apprentice boys of derry , in one of the largest but most controversial pro-union rallies of the referendum campaign .
you can read a longer piece here .
members of the orange lodges march through glasgow city centre .

documents.title: press review
text: the scotsman a former nato ambassador has said scotland would be welcomed into the the military alliance after a yes vote , regardless of any decision to ditch trident .
that 's a smaller front page story in the scotsman , which has a longer story inside on the comments by dame mariot leslie .

the telegraph like many others , the telegraph splashes on the murder of kidnapped journalist steven sotloff , but has a smaller front page story on a determined new bid '' by labour to recapture traditional labour party voters which will be spearheaded by john reid and gordon brown .

the guardian the former eu commissioner for monetary union said it would not be possible for an independent scotland to join the eu if it used the pound without a formal currency deal or its own central bank .
that 's an inside story story in guardian , which also covers yesterday 's yougov poll .
i 'll bring you some more from the papers in a few moments .
good morning and welcome to today 's live blog coverage of the scottish independence referendum campaign .
it 's a busy day as ever on the campaign trail .
among early developments , a senior member of the church of scotland has voiced concerns about what he described as an apparent increase in aggression and bitterness .
following accusations against people on sides of the debate , the moderator of the general assembly of the church of scotland , john chalmers called for more dignity and respect to be shown .
as it happens , figures from both sides will come together later for an event billed as a show of uniity .
yes scotland and better together will put their political differences aside in a charity penalty shoot-out for the scotland united against motor neuron disease '' campaign .
at the same time , a full day of campaigning is ahead .
